definition: to advance together
and/furthermore/also/together with/(not) at all/simultaneously/to combine/to join/to merge
to go forward/to advance/to go in/to enter/to put in/to submit/to take in/to admit/(math.) base of a number system/classifier for sections in a building or residential compound
to go forward together (idiom); to undertake simultaneous tasks/going hand in hand

sentences.english: Refactoring goes hand in hand with automated testing.
sentences.chinese: 重構與自動化測試是攜手並進的。

sentences.english: Schools and universities have been unable to keep up.
sentences.chinese: 學校的教育無法與時並進。

sentences.english: Their troops advanced by both land and water, and arrived at the front in time.
sentences.chinese: 他們的部隊水陸並進，及時抵達前線。

sentences.english: A multipronged approach could address that dilemma. Like Mr.
sentences.chinese: 或許多頭並進的手段可以化解這個難題。

sentences.english: Horse Racing and Thoroughbred Sales go hand in hand at Magic Millions.
sentences.chinese: 賽馬及良種銷售齊頭並進，在魔術數百萬人。

sentences.english: The right way to reduce our excess nuclear forces is in parallel with Russia.
sentences.chinese: 減少我們過剩核力量的正確途徑是與俄羅斯齊頭並進。

sentences.english: With its instant coffee line, Starbucks is doing both.
sentences.chinese: 伴隨着速溶咖啡生產現，星巴克正在兩腿並進。

sentences.english: Work and rest go together, hand in hand.
sentences.chinese: 工作和休息齊頭並進，相得益彰。

sentences.english: And it does not align IT and the business.
sentences.chinese: 而且它不能讓IT與業務保持齊頭並進。

sentences.english: No matter how the international landscape may evolve, China and the EU should always join hands and forge ahead like passengers in the same boat.
sentences.chinese: 不管國際風雲如何變幻，中歐要同舟共濟，攜手並進。

sentences.english: At the end of the fourth lap, Sun Mei and I were neck and neck.
sentences.chinese: 在第四圈的最後一段，孫梅和我齊頭並進。

sentences.english: We will create excellence hand in hand with you.
sentences.chinese: 福瑞人將與您攜手並進，共創佳績。

sentences.english: This invisibility effect will slowly wear off with the sim becoming more solid as time progresses.
sentences.chinese: 這個隱形效果會慢慢減弱，與時並進辛變得更加牢固。

sentences.english: They travel in tight packs, sometimes as many as 20 abreast.
sentences.chinese: 他們密集穿行，有時候多達20輛車齊頭並進。

sentences.english: Conservation and development can go hand in hand.
sentences.chinese: 保護和開發可以聯手並進。

sentences.english: Wonderful light hidden ghee factory with you hand in hand, create beautiful future.
sentences.chinese: 妙光藏酥油廠與大家攜手並進，共創美好未來。

definition: to launch/to develop/to unfold/(of an exhibition etc) to open
to advance/to conduct/underway/in progress/to do/to carry out/to carry on/to execute
to push (for acceptance of a plan)/to push forward/to promote/to actuate/CL:個|个[ge4]
to make progress/to do better/fig. ambitious to improve oneself/to move forwards
one step further/to move forward a step/further onwards
less advanced/underdeveloped/lagging behind/the younger generation/the less experienced ones
by means of/through/via/to pass through/to get through/to adopt/to pass (a bill or inspection etc)/to switch over
active/energetic/vigorous/positive (outlook)/proactive
practice/to put into practice/to live up to (a promise)/to carry out (a project)
to provide assistance/to aid
to unfold/to carry out/to be in full swing/to launch
practical/workable/to implement/to carry out/to decide
thus/thereby
to crane one's neck/to await eagerly/to lead/to show the way
operation/action/CL:個|个[ge4]/to move about/mobile
to start (a machine)/(fig.) to set in motion/to launch (an operation)/to activate (a plan)
